meanings.definition: An inheritance from a father or ancestor.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather left me a small patrimony of old books and family heirlooms.
meanings.sent2: She inherited a large patrimony of land and property from her father.
meanings.sent3: The patrimony of antique coins from my dad seems to magically grow every time I visit.
meanings.sent4: The patrimony of wisdom passed down from generations shines like a beacon in times of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The old house stood as a testament to the patrimony of craftsmanship in our family.

meanings.definition: An estate inherited from one's father or ancestors.
meanings.sent1: The sprawling mansion was his patrimony, passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: She sold off the family patrimony to start a new life in the city.
meanings.sent3: The patrimony of antique furniture filled the house with memories of bygone eras.
meanings.sent4: The patrimony of knowledge in the library was a treasure trove waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The vast patrimony of farmland stretched as far as the eye could see.

meanings.sent1: The traditions of our family form a rich patrimony that we cherish.
meanings.sent2: She felt a deep connection to the patrimony of stories passed down through the generations.
meanings.sent3: The patrimony of recipes from our ancestors always brings the family together.
meanings.sent4: The patrimony of courage instilled in us by our forefathers guides us through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The patrimony of love and resilience is the greatest gift from our lineage.
